column5: Just a quick note from last week. The fishing was great from Saturday to Wednesday and good on Thursday and Friday. The weather was great, too good to be honest. Low 80's all week, no wind and no clouds. Here are a couple of pictures from the week.The walleye was a 25 12", Norther #1 was 34 1/2" with a 16" walleye in his mouth and we netted them both, Northern #2 my 13 year old caught was 35 1/2".Hope everyone else has a great trip north this year.TonyO
thanks for the tip. with the search function I found the link.https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...d.php?t=244745Awesome pictures Mike!
From Indian Lake Chain. 28.5 and right at 8lbs. She was a football.
The trip reports are starting to roll in, but where are all the pictures????? Telling us you caught a fish is nice. SHOWING us that fish is 100 times better.
You want pictures - check out Solo's reports.National Geo quality
Already bookmarked But I'm sure normal humans take pictures too.
how about a link to solo's album. I want to check them out!
He started a thread on here that links to his write-up on the the Ontario site. Definitely check it out ..... great read and superb photography.

The weather and fishing were both incredible last week. We were at Snake Falls Camp on Pakwash. Here are a couple just to give you an idea... And not sure if anyone else who was up north last week happened to look up after 11pm on Thursday night, but the Northern Lights put on a show like we've never seen before. (unfortunately no pictures of those) They lit up the entire sky! First time we've seen them in June and have never seen them fill the sky and move so fast!
Yea, it seem that the lights were right above us. We didn't really have the striking colors like I've seen before. Way too cool!
